name: Data.Oregon.Gov
description: The Data.Oregon.gov website lets visitors interact with state records, create their own charts, graphs, calendars and maps, and save them online. Oregon's Open Data Portal has received the top awards from the Center for Digital Government and the National Association of State Chief Information Officers. Oregonians want more access to data collected and stored by Oregon's state and local government agencies. In response, Oregon launched the Data.Oregon.gov website to provide Oregonians the ability to view, search, sort, filter, download or build applications to access public data.
